meanings.definition: The quality of being rough or harsh in texture or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The coarsenesses of the sandpaper made it difficult to use on the delicate wood.
meanings.sent2: I could feel the coarsenesses of the gravel under my feet as I walked along the path.
meanings.sent3: The coarsenesses of the old rug were so extreme that it felt like walking on a bed of nails.
meanings.sent4: The coarsenesses of the mountain terrain made it a challenging hike for even experienced climbers.
meanings.sent5: The coarsenesses of the burlap sack rubbed against my skin, leaving it red and irritated.

meanings.definition: The state of being vulgar or indecent in speech or behavior.
meanings.sent1: The coarsenesses of his language shocked everyone in the room.
meanings.sent2: She was taken aback by the coarsenesses of the jokes he told at the party.
meanings.sent3: Despite his coarsenesses, he somehow managed to charm his way out of trouble.
meanings.sent4: The coarsenesses of his humor often crossed the line into offensiveness.
meanings.sent5: Her coarsenesses in public made her the subject of gossip among the townspeople.
